CVE-2024-5915(CVSS UNKNOWN)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-08-14T18:32:49

4 posts

A privilege escalation (PE) vulnerability in the Palo Alto Networks GlobalProtect app on Windows devices enables a local user to execute programs with elevated privileges.

screaminggoat at 2024-08-14T17:37:36.933Z ##

Palo Alto Networks security advisories:

  • CVE-2024-5914 Cortex XSOAR: Command Injection in CommonScripts Pack (CVSSv4: 7.0 high)
  • CVE-2024-5916 PAN-OS: Cleartext Exposure of External System Secrets (CVSSv4: 6.0 medium)
  • CVE-2024-5915 GlobalProtect App: Local Privilege Escalation (PE) Vulnerability (CVSSv4: 5.2 medium)
  • PAN-SA-2024-0007 Prisma Access Browser: Monthly Vulnerability Updates 31 Chromium CVEs from 6772-6779, 6988-6991, 6994-7001, 7003-7005, 7255-7256, 7533-7536, 7550. These CVEs are fixed in Prisma Access Browser 1.0 (supersedes Talon Browser), and all later Prisma Access Browser versions.

"Palo Alto Networks is not aware of any malicious exploitation of this issue."

#panw #paloaltonetworks #patchtuesday #vulnerability #cve

##
AAKL at 2024-08-14T17:04:48.472Z ##

Palo Alto has several new advisories for CVE-2024-5914, CVE-2024-5916, and CVE-2024-5915 https://security.paloaltonetworks.com/ @paloaltontwks #cybersecurity #infosec

Palo Alto Networks security advisories:

  • CVE-2024-5914 Cortex XSOAR: Command Injection in CommonScripts Pack (CVSSv4: 7.0 high)
  • CVE-2024-5916 PAN-OS: Cleartext Exposure of External System Secrets (CVSSv4: 6.0 medium)
  • CVE-2024-5915 GlobalProtect App: Local Privilege Escalation (PE) Vulnerability (CVSSv4: 5.2 medium)
  • PAN-SA-2024-0007 Prisma Access Browser: Monthly Vulnerability Updates 31 Chromium CVEs from 6772-6779, 6988-6991, 6994-7001, 7003-7005, 7255-7256, 7533-7536, 7550. These CVEs are fixed in Prisma Access Browser 1.0 (supersedes Talon Browser), and all later Prisma Access Browser versions.

"Palo Alto Networks is not aware of any malicious exploitation of this issue."

##

CVE-2024-5914(CVSS UNKNOWN)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-08-14T18:32:49

4 posts

A command injection issue in Palo Alto Networks Cortex XSOAR CommonScripts Pack allows an unauthenticated attacker to execute arbitrary commands within the context of an integration container.

screaminggoat at 2024-08-14T17:37:36.933Z ##

Palo Alto Networks security advisories:

  • CVE-2024-5914 Cortex XSOAR: Command Injection in CommonScripts Pack (CVSSv4: 7.0 high)
  • CVE-2024-5916 PAN-OS: Cleartext Exposure of External System Secrets (CVSSv4: 6.0 medium)
  • CVE-2024-5915 GlobalProtect App: Local Privilege Escalation (PE) Vulnerability (CVSSv4: 5.2 medium)
  • PAN-SA-2024-0007 Prisma Access Browser: Monthly Vulnerability Updates 31 Chromium CVEs from 6772-6779, 6988-6991, 6994-7001, 7003-7005, 7255-7256, 7533-7536, 7550. These CVEs are fixed in Prisma Access Browser 1.0 (supersedes Talon Browser), and all later Prisma Access Browser versions.

"Palo Alto Networks is not aware of any malicious exploitation of this issue."

#panw #paloaltonetworks #patchtuesday #vulnerability #cve

AAKL at 2024-08-14T17:04:48.472Z ##

##

CVE-2024-5916(CVSS UNKNOWN)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-08-14T18:32:49

4 posts

An information exposure vulnerability in Palo Alto Networks PAN-OS software enables a local system administrator to unintentionally disclose secrets, passwords, and tokens of external systems. A read-only administrator who has access to the config log, can read secrets, passwords, and tokens to external systems.

screaminggoat at 2024-08-14T17:37:36.933Z ##

  • CVE-2024-5914 Cortex XSOAR: Command Injection in CommonScripts Pack (CVSSv4: 7.0 high)

  • CVE-2024-5915 GlobalProtect App: Local Privilege Escalation (PE) Vulnerability (CVSSv4: 5.2 medium)
  • PAN-SA-2024-0007 Prisma Access Browser: Monthly Vulnerability Updates 31 Chromium CVEs from 6772-6779, 6988-6991, 6994-7001, 7003-7005, 7255-7256, 7533-7536, 7550. These CVEs are fixed in Prisma Access Browser 1.0 (supersedes Talon Browser), and all later Prisma Access Browser versions.

##

CVE-2024-42473
(7.5 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-08-14T17:18:27

1 posts

## Overview OpenFGA v1.5.7 and v1.5.8 are vulnerable to authorization bypass when calling Check API with a model that uses `but not` and `from` expressions and a userset. ## Fix - If you are using OpenFGA within Docker or as a Go library, as a binary, or through Docker, upgrade to v1.5.9 as soon as possible - If using Helm chart, upgrade to 0.2.12 as soon as possible. This fix is backward co

openfga@mastodon.social at 2024-08-09T21:48:12.000Z ##

We introduced a regression in OpenFGA `v1.5.7`/`v.1.5.8` that causes OpenFGA to return incorrect values when calling the Check API for some specific models/tuples.
We are working on a fix, but meanwhile we recommend you to downgrade to `v1.5.6` until `v1.5.9` is released.

This has been assigned CVE-2024-42473

Details here https://github.com/openfga/openfga/security/advisories/GHSA-3f6g-m4hr-59h8

#OpenFGA #Security #CVE

##

CVE-2024-38653
(8.2 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-08-14T15:32:17

2 posts

XXE in SmartDeviceServer in Ivanti Avalanche 6.3.1 allows a remote unauthenticated attacker to read arbitrary files on the server.

screaminggoat at 2024-08-13T14:26:56.847Z ##

Ivanti security advisories: August Security Update
Today, fixes have been released for the following solutions: Ivanti Neurons for ITSM, Ivanti Avalanche and Ivanti Virtual Traffic Manager (vTM).

  • Ivanti Neurons for ITSM
  • Ivanti Avalanche 6.4.4
  • Ivanti Virtual Traffic Manager (vTM )

The concerning CVEs:

  • CVE-2024-7569 (9.6 critical) An information disclosure vulnerability in Ivanti ITSM on-prem and Neurons for ITSM
  • CVE-2024-7593 (9.8 critical) authentication bypass in Ivanti vTM (PUBLICLY DISCLOSED)
    • "We are not aware of any customers being exploited by this vulnerability at the time of disclosure. However, a Proof of Concept is publicly available"

"We have no evidence of these vulnerabilities being exploited in the wild. These vulnerabilities do not impact any other Ivanti products or solutions."

See related Bleeping Computer reporting: Ivanti warns of critical vTM auth bypass with public exploit

#CVE #PatchTuesday #Ivanti #vulnerability

CVE-2024-39383
(7.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.05%

updated 2024-08-14T15:31:18

2 posts

Acrobat Reader versions 20.005.30636, 24.002.20965, 24.002.20964, 24.001.30123 and earlier are affected by a Use After Free vulnerability that could result in arbitrary code execution in the context of the current user. Exploitation of this issue requires user interaction in that a victim must open a malicious file.

1 repos

#search_error

screaminggoat at 2024-08-13T18:21:41.501Z ##

Adobe security advisories for #PatchTuesday:

  • APSB24-45 Security update available for Adobe Illustrator (7 CVEs)
  • APSB24-47 Security update available for Adobe Dimension (6)
  • APSB24-49 Security update available for Adobe Photoshop (1)
  • APSB24-56 Security update available for Adobe InDesign (13)
  • APSB24-57 Security update available for Adobe Acrobat Reader (12)
  • APSB24-59 Security update available for Adobe Bridge (3)
  • APSB24-60 Security update available for Adobe Substance 3D Stager (1)
  • APSB24-61 Security update available for Adobe Commerce (23)
  • APSB24-64 Security update available for Adobe InCopy (1)
  • APSB24-65 Security update available for Adobe Substance 3D Sampler (4)
  • APSB24-67 Security update available for Adobe Substance 3D Designer (1)

Unfortunately the potentially exploited zero-day did not pan out, as there is no mention of exploitation in the Adobe Reader security advisory. See parent toots above for additional information about that one. Haifei Li of EXPMON and Check Point Research are credited for CVE-2024-39383 (7.8 high) Use After Free vulnerability (impact: arbitrary code execution).

#Adobe #vulnerability #CVE

Ivanti security advisories: August Security Update
Today, fixes have been released for the following solutions: Ivanti Neurons for ITSM, Ivanti Avalanche and Ivanti Virtual Traffic Manager (vTM).

  • Ivanti Neurons for ITSM
  • Ivanti Avalanche 6.4.4
  • Ivanti Virtual Traffic Manager (vTM )

  • CVE-2024-7593 (9.8 critical) authentication bypass in Ivanti vTM (PUBLICLY DISCLOSED)

Windows TCP/IP RCE CVSS 9.8 out of 10.
An unauthenticated attacker could repeatedly send IPv6 packets, that include specially crafted packets, to a Windows machine which could enable remote code execution.

##
mttaggart@infosec.town at 2024-08-14T22:25:02.209Z ##

What am I missing with the reporting about #CVE_2024_38063?

I haven't seen a PoC. I don't know that even the reporters were able to demonstrate RCE. "Exploitation More Likely" does not mean "We received a working PoC for RCE from the reporter." At least, I don't think so. And it's not in the wild, right? So is this just a "no-click" hypetrain?

Let's find out how I'm wrong!

msrc.microsoft.com/update-guide/vulnerability/CVE-2024-38063

##
mttaggart@infosec.town at 2024-08-14T22:25:02.209Z ##

What am I missing with the reporting about #CVE_2024_38063?

I haven't seen a PoC. I don't know that even the reporters were able to demonstrate RCE. "Exploitation More Likely" does not mean "We received a working PoC for RCE from the reporter." At least, I don't think so. And it's not in the wild, right? So is this just a "no-click" hypetrain?

Let's find out how I'm wrong!

msrc.microsoft.com/update-guide/vulnerability/CVE-2024-38063

##
decio at 2024-08-16T07:37:10.114Z ##

[Related to CVE-2024-38063 ]

ð
â¬ï¸

â¬ï¸

##
malwaretech at 2024-08-16T05:40:22.606Z ##

Has anyone else looked at CVE-2024-38063? I could use a sanity check here. From what I can see, the vulnerable code path can only be triggered with IPv6 Jumbograms (packets larger than 65535 bytes). Not only would the target system need to have Jumbograms enabled, but every link in the path between the attacker and target would have to both support Jumbograms and have them enabled. I can't imagine any real world scenario in which this would occur, so unless I'm missing something, this vulnerability could only be exploited on very few real world systems.

##
JuanPC@mastodon.online at 2024-08-16T05:27:51.000Z ##

Fallo ð¥ CRÃTICO en #Windows. Afecta a equipos con #ipv6 activo. @microsoft publica los parches : https://msrc.microsoft.com/update-guide/vulnerability/CVE-2024-38063

##
padraig@mastodon.ie at 2024-08-15T23:08:41.000Z ##

RCE Vulnerability Affects All Windows Systems Using IPv6

"An unauthenticated attacker could repeatedly send IPv6 packets, that include specially crafted packets, to a Windows machine which could enable remote code execution."

CVE-2024-38063
CVSS: 9.8

https://msrc.microsoft.com/update-guide/vulnerability/CVE-2024-38063

(To fix: Disable IPv6 within Network Settings)

##
nikolozk at 2024-08-15T10:18:05.034Z ##

Critical Windows IPv6 vulnerability (CVE-2024-38063) requires immediate patching:

â¢ Affects all Windows systems with IPv6 enabled (default setting)
â¢ Remote Code Execution (RCE) vulnerability caused by Integer Underflow
â¢ Exploitable by unauthenticated attackers using crafted IPv6 packets
â¢ Low-complexity attack could lead to arbitrary code execution

Microsoft emphasizes high-priority treatment, citing past exploitation of similar vulnerabilities.

https://www.bleepingcomputer.com/news/microsoft/zero-click-windows-tcp-ip-rce-impacts-all-systems-with-ipv6-enabled-patch-now/

##
floe@hci.social at 2024-08-14T22:23:44.000Z ##

Well, well, well.

A remote code execution vulnerability, right in the Windows IPv6 stack. https://msrc.microsoft.com/update-guide/vulnerability/CVE-2024-38063

Anyone remember the Win95 ping of death, or the Conficker worm? This has the potential to make the Crowdstrike outage look harmless in comparison.

Popcorn.

(Only reason this doesn't have a straight 10.0 as CVE severity score is probably because IPv6 coverage is still abysmal. ð¤­)

##
screaminggoat at 2024-08-14T03:04:50.672Z ##

@kaur Thank you for highlighting CVE-2024-38063. I was so focused on the zero days that I overlooked this.

I'm trying to visualize the technical details from the limited information:

  • CWE-191: Integer Underflow (Wrap or Wraparound)
  • An unauthenticated attacker could repeatedly send IPv6 packets, that include specially crafted packets, to a Windows machine which could enable remote code execution.
  • Systems are not affected if IPv6 is disabled on the target machine.
  • CVSS:3.1/AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:N/S:U/C:H/I:H/A:H

##

CVE-2024-7593
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-08-14T02:07:05.410000

11 posts

Incorrect implementation of an authentication algorithm in Ivanti vTM other than versions 22.2R1 or 22.7R2 allows a remote unauthenticated attacker to bypass authentication of the admin panel.

nopatience@swecyb.com at 2024-08-14T14:41:03.000Z ##

The Ivanti vTM vulnerability. There is talk about a publicly known exploit... It's in metasploit and will add an administrative user.

It's right there. Why not say so instead of this "we are aware of a known exploit".

Oh and the guidelines from Ivanti includes logs from when the vulnerability has been (ab)used. Good things to look for.

#CVE_2024_7593 #CVE_2024 #Ivanti

#ThreatIntel

The Ivanti vTM vulnerability. There is talk about a publicly known exploit... It's in metasploit and will add an administrative user.

It's right there. Why not say so instead of this "we are aware of a known exploit".

Oh and the guidelines from Ivanti includes logs from when the vulnerability has been (ab)used. Good things to look for.

#CVE_2024_7593 #CVE_2024 #Ivanti

#ThreatIntel

##
AAKL at 2024-08-14T17:07:04.975Z ##

adulau at 2024-08-14T06:56:41.841Z ##

Incorrect implementation of an authentication algorithm in Ivanti vTM other than versions 22.2R1 or 22.7R2 allows a remote unauthenticated attacker to bypass authentication of the admin panel.

##
screaminggoat at 2024-08-13T14:26:56.847Z ##

Ivanti security advisories: August Security Update
Today, fixes have been released for the following solutions: Ivanti Neurons for ITSM, Ivanti Avalanche and Ivanti Virtual Traffic Manager (vTM).

  • Ivanti Neurons for ITSM
  • Ivanti Avalanche 6.4.4
  • Ivanti Virtual Traffic Manager (vTM )

The concerning CVEs:

  • CVE-2024-7569 (9.6 critical) An information disclosure vulnerability in Ivanti ITSM on-prem and Neurons for ITSM
  • CVE-2024-7593 (9.8 critical) authentication bypass in Ivanti vTM (PUBLICLY DISCLOSED)
    • "We are not aware of any customers being exploited by this vulnerability at the time of disclosure. However, a Proof of Concept is publicly available"

"We have no evidence of these vulnerabilities being exploited in the wild. These vulnerabilities do not impact any other Ivanti products or solutions."

See related Bleeping Computer reporting: Ivanti warns of critical vTM auth bypass with public exploit

#CVE #PatchTuesday #Ivanti #vulnerability

CVE-2024-28986
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.07%

updated 2024-08-14T00:31:10

18 posts

SolarWinds Web Help Desk was found to be susceptible to a Java Deserialization Remote Code Execution vulnerability that, if exploited, would allow an attacker to run commands on the host machine. While it was reported as an unauthenticated vulnerability, SolarWinds has been unable to reproduce it without authentication after thorough testing. Â  However, out of an abundance of caution, we re

screaminggoat at 2024-08-15T14:23:59.638Z ##

CISA: CISA Adds One Known Exploited Vulnerability to Catalog
Hot off the press! CISA adds CVE-2024-28986 (9.8 critical, disclosed 13 August 2024 by SolarWinds) SolarWinds Web Help Desk Java Deserialization Remote Code Execution Vulnerability to the Known Exploited Vulnerabilities Catalog.

Note: There was no indication that CVE-2024-28986 was being exploited in the wild in the security advisory.

cc: @campuscodi h/t: @hrbrmstr

#CVE_2024_28986 #SolarWinds #vulnerability #eitw #activeexploitation #cisa #kev #KnownExploitedVulnerabilitiesCatalog

##
screaminggoat at 2024-08-14T18:11:25.255Z ##

SolarWinds security advisory: SolarWinds Web Help Desk Java Deserialization Remote Code Execution Vulnerability (CVE-2024-28986)
CVE-2024-28986 (CVSSv3: 9.8 critical) SolarWinds Web Help Desk was found to be susceptible to a Java Deserialization Remote Code Execution vulnerability that, if exploited, would allow an attacker to run commands on the host machine.

Note: While it was reported as an unauthenticated vulnerability, SolarWinds has been unable to reproduce it without authentication after thorough testing. Thus CVSS:3.1/AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:N/S:U/C:H/I:H/A:H

See related Bleeping Computer reporting: SolarWinds fixes critical RCE bug affecting all Web Help Desk versions

#CVE_2024_28986 #SolarWinds #vulnerability #CVE

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-08-15T14:23:59.000Z ##

CISA: CISA Adds One Known Exploited Vulnerability to Catalog
Hot off the press! CISA adds CVE-2024-28986 (9.8 critical, disclosed 13 August 2024 by SolarWinds) SolarWinds Web Help Desk Java Deserialization Remote Code Execution Vulnerability to the Known Exploited Vulnerabilities Catalog.

Note: There was no indication that CVE-2024-28986 was being exploited in the wild in the security advisory.

cc: @campuscodi h/t: @hrbrmstr

SolarWinds security advisory: SolarWinds Web Help Desk Java Deserialization Remote Code Execution Vulnerability (CVE-2024-28986)
CVE-2024-28986 (CVSSv3: 9.8 critical) SolarWinds Web Help Desk was found to be susceptible to a Java Deserialization Remote Code Execution vulnerability that, if exploited, would allow an attacker to run commands on the host machine.

Note: While it was reported as an unauthenticated vulnerability, SolarWinds has been unable to reproduce it without authentication after thorough testing. Thus CVSS:3.1/AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:N/S:U/C:H/I:H/A:H

See related Bleeping Computer reporting: SolarWinds fixes critical RCE bug affecting all Web Help Desk versions

##

CVE-2024-38206
(6.5 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.06%

updated 2024-08-14T00:15:08.213000

2 posts

An authenticated attacker can bypass Server-Side Request Forgery (SSRF) protection in Microsoft Copilot Studio to leak sensitive information over a network.

1 repos

#search_error

screaminggoat at 2024-08-07T00:29:47.861Z ##

Microsoft Security Response Center (MSRC) security advisories:

  • CVE-2024-38206 (8.5 high) Microsoft Copilot Studio Information Disclosure Vulnerability
    An authenticated attacker can bypass Server-Side Request Forgery (SSRF) protection in Microsoft Copilot Studio to leak sensitive information over a network.
  • CVE-2024-38166 (8.2 high) Microsoft Dynamics 365 Cross-site Scripting Vulnerability
    An unauthenticated attacker can exploit improper neutralization of input during web page generation in Microsoft Dynamics 365 to spoof over a network by tricking a user to click on a link.

The vulnerability documented by this CVE requires no customer action to resolve

Both vulnerabilities are not exploited, not publicly disclosed, exploitation less likely.

#CVE_2024_38206 #CVE_2024_38166 #Microsoft #MSRC #vulnerability #CVE #PatchTuesday #Copilot #dynamics365

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-08-07T00:29:47.000Z ##

Microsoft Security Response Center (MSRC) security advisories:

  • CVE-2024-38206 (8.5 high) Microsoft Copilot Studio Information Disclosure Vulnerability
    An authenticated attacker can bypass Server-Side Request Forgery (SSRF) protection in Microsoft Copilot Studio to leak sensitive information over a network.
  • CVE-2024-38166 (8.2 high) Microsoft Dynamics 365 Cross-site Scripting Vulnerability
    An unauthenticated attacker can exploit improper neutralization of input during web page generation in Microsoft Dynamics 365 to spoof over a network by tricking a user to click on a link.

The vulnerability documented by this CVE requires no customer action to resolve

Both vulnerabilities are not exploited, not publicly disclosed, exploitation less likely.

#CVE_2024_38206 #CVE_2024_38166 #Microsoft #MSRC #vulnerability #CVE #PatchTuesday #Copilot #dynamics365

CVE-2024-7569
(9.7 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-08-13T21:32:02

2 posts

An information disclosure vulnerability in Ivanti ITSM on-prem and Neurons for ITSM versions 2023.4 and earlier allows an unauthenticated attacker to obtain the OIDC client secret via debug information.

screaminggoat at 2024-08-13T14:26:56.847Z ##

Ivanti security advisories: August Security Update
Today, fixes have been released for the following solutions: Ivanti Neurons for ITSM, Ivanti Avalanche and Ivanti Virtual Traffic Manager (vTM).

  • Ivanti Neurons for ITSM
  • Ivanti Avalanche 6.4.4
  • Ivanti Virtual Traffic Manager (vTM )

The concerning CVEs:

  • CVE-2024-7569 (9.6 critical) An information disclosure vulnerability in Ivanti ITSM on-prem and Neurons for ITSM
  • CVE-2024-7593 (9.8 critical) authentication bypass in Ivanti vTM (PUBLICLY DISCLOSED)
    • "We are not aware of any customers being exploited by this vulnerability at the time of disclosure. However, a Proof of Concept is publicly available"

"We have no evidence of these vulnerabilities being exploited in the wild. These vulnerabilities do not impact any other Ivanti products or solutions."

See related Bleeping Computer reporting: Ivanti warns of critical vTM auth bypass with public exploit

#CVE #PatchTuesday #Ivanti #vulnerability

CVE-2024-36877
(8.3 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-08-13T21:31:55

1 posts

Micro-Star International Z-series motherboards (Z590, Z490, and Z790) and B-series motherboards (B760, B560, B660, and B460) with firmware 7D25v14, 7D25v17 to 7D25v19, and 7D25v1A to 7D25v1H was discovered to contain a write-what-where condition in the in the SW handler for SMI 0xE3.

CVE-2023-31315
(7.6 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-08-13T18:32:21

1 posts

Improper validation in a model specific register (MSR) could allow a malicious program with ring0 access to modify SMM configuration while SMI lock is enabled, potentially leading to arbitrary code execution.

Larvitz@burningboard.net at 2024-08-11T12:43:54.000Z ##

Patched my desktop PC for the Sinkclose (CVE-2023-31315) AMD cpu hardware vulnerability.

Of course, as always, the MSI firmware upgrade, nuked my Linux boot loader out of the EFI and I had to use a USB live-media to manually fix that using a grub-install ...

#linux #msi #bios #update #security #cve_2023_31315 #sinkclose

##

CVE-2024-38213
(6.5 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 1.42%

updated 2024-08-13T18:31:25

15 posts

Windows Mark of the Web Security Feature Bypass Vulnerability

screaminggoat at 2024-08-15T15:59:01.719Z ##

Zero Day Initiative (ZDI): CVE-2024-38213: Copy2Pwn Exploit Evades Windows Web Protection
ZDI provides the deets on CVE-2024-38213 (6.5 medium, disclosed 13 August 2024 by Microsoft as an exploited zero-day, added to CISA KEV Catalog same day) Windows Mark of the Web Security Feature Bypass Vulnerability. Bleeping Computer originally broke the news that this Windows SmartScreen bypass was exploited as zero-day since March 2024, and that Microsoft actually patched it in June but forgot to disclose it. (imagine forgetting about announcing an exploited zero-day, fuck you Microsoft)

So Trend Micro's Zero Day Initiative Threat Hunting team disclosed how DarkGate operators bypassed Mark-of-the-Web (MotW) protections using CVE-2024-38213, by explaining Web-based Distributed Authoring and Versioning (WebDAV), and how threat actors hosted payloads on WebDAV shares. "Threat actors have discovered that Windows does not always handle or properly apply the Mark-of-the-Web to files served over WebDAV."

#threatintel #CVE_2024_38213 #windows #zeroday #vulnerability #eitw #activeexploitation #darkgate #webDAV #motw #markoftheweb

##
screaminggoat at 2024-08-13T19:04:41.470Z ##

CISA: CISA Adds Six Known Exploited Vulnerabilities to Catalog
Hot off the press! CISA adds all the Microsoft zero days to the Known Exploited Vulnerabilities Catalog:

  • CVE-2024-38189 (8.8 high) Microsoft Project Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-38178 (7.5 high) Microsoft Windows Scripting Engine Memory Corruption Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-38213 (6.5 medium) Microsoft Windows SmartScreen Security Feature Bypass Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-38193 (7.8 high) Microsoft Windows Ancillary Function Driver for WinSock Privilege Escalation Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-38106 (7.0 high) Microsoft Windows Kernel Privilege Escalation Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-38107 (7.8 high) Microsoft Windows Power Dependency Coordinator Privilege Escalation Vulnerability

#CVE_2024_38189 #CVE_2024_38178 #CVE_2024_38213 #CVE_2024_38193 #CVE_2024_38106 #CVE_2024_38107 #zeroday #Microsoft #eitw #activeexploitation #KEV #KnownExploitedVulnerabilitiesCatalog #CISA #vulnerability #CVE

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-08-15T15:59:01.000Z ##

Zero Day Initiative (ZDI): CVE-2024-38213: Copy2Pwn Exploit Evades Windows Web Protection
ZDI provides the deets on CVE-2024-38213 (6.5 medium, disclosed 13 August 2024 by Microsoft as an exploited zero-day, added to CISA KEV Catalog same day) Windows Mark of the Web Security Feature Bypass Vulnerability. Bleeping Computer originally broke the news that this Windows SmartScreen bypass was exploited as zero-day since March 2024, and that Microsoft actually patched it in June but forgot to disclose it. (imagine forgetting about announcing an exploited zero-day, fuck you Microsoft)

So Trend Micro's Zero Day Initiative Threat Hunting team disclosed how DarkGate operators bypassed Mark-of-the-Web (MotW) protections using CVE-2024-38213, by explaining Web-based Distributed Authoring and Versioning (WebDAV), and how threat actors hosted payloads on WebDAV shares. "Threat actors have discovered that Windows does not always handle or properly apply the Mark-of-the-Web to files served over WebDAV."

#threatintel #CVE_2024_38213 #windows #zeroday #vulnerability #eitw #activeexploitation #darkgate #webDAV #motw #markoftheweb

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-08-13T19:04:41.000Z ##

CISA: CISA Adds Six Known Exploited Vulnerabilities to Catalog
Hot off the press! CISA adds all the Microsoft zero days to the Known Exploited Vulnerabilities Catalog:

  • CVE-2024-38189 (8.8 high) Microsoft Project Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-38178 (7.5 high) Microsoft Windows Scripting Engine Memory Corruption Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-38213 (6.5 medium) Microsoft Windows SmartScreen Security Feature Bypass Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-38193 (7.8 high) Microsoft Windows Ancillary Function Driver for WinSock Privilege Escalation Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-38106 (7.0 high) Microsoft Windows Kernel Privilege Escalation Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-38107 (7.8 high) Microsoft Windows Power Dependency Coordinator Privilege Escalation Vulnerability

##
screaminggoat at 2024-08-15T15:59:01.719Z ##

Zero Day Initiative (ZDI): CVE-2024-38213: Copy2Pwn Exploit Evades Windows Web Protection
ZDI provides the deets on CVE-2024-38213 (6.5 medium, disclosed 13 August 2024 by Microsoft as an exploited zero-day, added to CISA KEV Catalog same day) Windows Mark of the Web Security Feature Bypass Vulnerability. Bleeping Computer originally broke the news that this Windows SmartScreen bypass was exploited as zero-day since March 2024, and that Microsoft actually patched it in June but forgot to disclose it. (imagine forgetting about announcing an exploited zero-day, fuck you Microsoft)

So Trend Micro's Zero Day Initiative Threat Hunting team disclosed how DarkGate operators bypassed Mark-of-the-Web (MotW) protections using CVE-2024-38213, by explaining Web-based Distributed Authoring and Versioning (WebDAV), and how threat actors hosted payloads on WebDAV shares. "Threat actors have discovered that Windows does not always handle or properly apply the Mark-of-the-Web to files served over WebDAV."

Bleeping Computer originally broke the news that this Windows SmartScreen bypass was exploited as zero-day since March 2024, and that Microsoft actually patched it in June but forgot to disclose it. (imagine forgetting about announcing an exploited zero-day, fuck you Microsoft)

So Trend Micro's Zero Day Initiative Threat Hunting team disclosed how DarkGate operators bypassed Mark-of-the-Web (MotW) protections using CVE-2024-38213, by explaining Web-based Distributed Authoring and Versioning (WebDAV), and how threat actors hosted payloads on WebDAV shares. "Threat actors have discovered that Windows does not always handle or properly apply the Mark-of-the-Web to files served over WebDAV."

##
thezdi at 2024-08-15T15:42:23.358Z ##

Microsoft fixed CVE-2024-38213 last Tuesday. It was discovered in the wild by ZDI threat hunter @gothburz. Today, he makes the details of the vulnerability and how it's being used by threat actors. https://www.zerodayinitiative.com/blog/2024/8/14/cve-2024-38213-copy2pwn-exploit-evades-windows-web-protections

patchnow24x7 at 2024-08-14T05:51:58.316Z ##

August 2024 : Microsoft Patch Tuesday Summary

August Patch Tuesday Release Note :
https://msrc.microsoft.com/update-guide/releaseNote/2024-Aug

The following are the 6 zero-day flaws exploited in the wild..

CVE-2024-38189 : https://msrc.microsoft.com/update-guide/en-US/vulnerability/CVE-2024-38189
CVE-2024-38178 : https://msrc.microsoft.com/update-guide/en-US/vulnerability/CVE-2024-38178
CVE-2024-38213 : https://msrc.microsoft.com/update-guide/en-US/vulnerability/CVE-2024-38213
CVE-2024-38193 : https://msrc.microsoft.com/update-guide/en-US/vulnerability/CVE-2024-38193
CVE-2024-38106 : https://msrc.microsoft.com/update-guide/en-US/vulnerability/CVE-2024-38106
CVE-2024-38107 : https://msrc.microsoft.com/update-guide/en-US/vulnerability/CVE-2024-38107

Remaining 4 Zero-Day Flaws:

CVE-2024-38202 : https://msrc.microsoft.com/update-guide/en-US/advisory/CVE-2024-38202
CVE-2024-38200 : https://msrc.microsoft.com/update-guide/en-US/advisory/CVE-2024-38200
CVE-2024-21302 : https://msrc.microsoft.com/update-guide/en-US/advisory/CVE-2024-21302
CVE-2024-38199 : https://msrc.microsoft.com/update-guide/en-US/advisory/CVE-2024-38199

screaminggoat at 2024-08-13T17:36:35.688Z ##

Happy Patch Tuesday from Microsoft: 87 vulnerabilities, 7 zero-days (6 exploited)

  • CVE-2024-38189 (8.8 high) Microsoft Project Remote Code Execution Vulnerability (exploited)
  • CVE-2024-38107 (7.8 high) Windows Power Dependency Coordinator Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability (exploited)
  • CVE-2024-38106 (7.0 high) Windows Kernel Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability (exploited)
  • CVE-2024-38213 (6.5 medium) Windows Mark of the Web Security Feature Bypass Vulnerability (exploited)
  • CVE-2024-38193 (7.8 high) Windows Ancillary Function Driver for WinSock Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability (exploited)
  • CVE-2024-38178 (7.5 high) Scripting Engine Memory Corruption Vulnerability (exploited)
  • CVE-2024-38199 (9.8 critical) Windows Line Printer Daemon (LPD) Service Remote Code Execution Vulnerability (publicly disclosed)

  • CVE-2024-38178 (7.5 high) Microsoft Windows Scripting Engine Memory Corruption Vulnerability

  • CVE-2024-38106 (7.0 high) Microsoft Windows Kernel Privilege Escalation Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-38107 (7.8 high) Microsoft Windows Power Dependency Coordinator Privilege Escalation Vulnerability

#CVE_2024_38189 #CVE_2024_38178 #CVE_2024_38213 #CVE_2024_38193 #CVE_2024_38106 #CVE_2024_38107 #zeroday #Microsoft #eitw #activeexploitation #KEV #KnownExploitedVulnerabilitiesCatalog #CISA #vulnerability #CVE

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-08-13T19:04:41.000Z ##

CISA: CISA Adds Six Known Exploited Vulnerabilities to Catalog
Hot off the press! CISA adds all the Microsoft zero days to the Known Exploited Vulnerabilities Catalog:

  • CVE-2024-38189 (8.8 high) Microsoft Project Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-38178 (7.5 high) Microsoft Windows Scripting Engine Memory Corruption Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-38213 (6.5 medium) Microsoft Windows SmartScreen Security Feature Bypass Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-38193 (7.8 high) Microsoft Windows Ancillary Function Driver for WinSock Privilege Escalation Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-38106 (7.0 high) Microsoft Windows Kernel Privilege Escalation Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-38107 (7.8 high) Microsoft Windows Power Dependency Coordinator Privilege Escalation Vulnerability

  • CVE-2024-38189 (8.8 high) Microsoft Project Remote Code Execution Vulnerability (exploited)
  • CVE-2024-38107 (7.8 high) Windows Power Dependency Coordinator Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability (exploited)
  • CVE-2024-38106 (7.0 high) Windows Kernel Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability (exploited)
  • CVE-2024-38213 (6.5 medium) Windows Mark of the Web Security Feature Bypass Vulnerability (exploited)
  • CVE-2024-38193 (7.8 high) Windows Ancillary Function Driver for WinSock Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability (exploited)
  • CVE-2024-38178 (7.5 high) Scripting Engine Memory Corruption Vulnerability (exploited)
  • CVE-2024-38199 (9.8 critical) Windows Line Printer Daemon (LPD) Service Remote Code Execution Vulnerability (publicly disclosed)

updated 2024-08-13T18:31:24

2 posts

An improper neutralization of input during web page generation ('cross-site scripting') in Fortinet FortiSOAR 7.3.0 through 7.3.2 allows an authenticated, remote attacker to inject arbitrary web script or HTML via the Communications module.

screaminggoat at 2024-08-13T16:35:39.511Z ##

Fortinet security advisories for #PatchTuesday:

  • FG-IR-22-445 CVE-2022-45862 (3.7 low) GUI Console WebSockets do not terminate on logout
  • FG-IR-24-012 CVE-2024-36505 (5.1 medium) Real-time file system integrity checking write protection bypass
  • FG-IR-22-047 CVE-2022-27486(6.7 medium) OS command injections in execute CLI commands
  • FG-IR-24-255 RADIUS Protocol CVE-2024-3596 (Fortinet gives it a 6.5 medium) aka #BlastRADIUS
  • FG-IR-23-467 CVE-2024-21757 (6.1 medium) Priviledged admin able to modify super-admins password
  • FG-IR-23-088 CVE-2023-26211 (6.8 medium) XSS vulnerability in communications triggered in playbooks

No mention of exploitation. CVE-2024-3596 was publicly disclosed 09 July 2024.

##

CVE-2024-38178
(7.5 HIGH)

EPSS: 1.61%

updated 2024-08-13T18:31:21

9 posts

Scripting Engine Memory Corruption Vulnerability

screaminggoat at 2024-08-13T19:04:41.470Z ##

CISA: CISA Adds Six Known Exploited Vulnerabilities to Catalog
Hot off the press! CISA adds all the Microsoft zero days to the Known Exploited Vulnerabilities Catalog:

  • CVE-2024-38189 (8.8 high) Microsoft Project Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-38178 (7.5 high) Microsoft Windows Scripting Engine Memory Corruption Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-38213 (6.5 medium) Microsoft Windows SmartScreen Security Feature Bypass Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-38193 (7.8 high) Microsoft Windows Ancillary Function Driver for WinSock Privilege Escalation Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-38106 (7.0 high) Microsoft Windows Kernel Privilege Escalation Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-38107 (7.8 high) Microsoft Windows Power Dependency Coordinator Privilege Escalation Vulnerability

August Patch Tuesday Release Note :
https://msrc.microsoft.com/update-guide/releaseNote/2024-Aug

The following are the 6 zero-day flaws exploited in the wild..

CVE-2024-38189 : https://msrc.microsoft.com/update-guide/en-US/vulnerability/CVE-2024-38189
CVE-2024-38178 : https://msrc.microsoft.com/update-guide/en-US/vulnerability/CVE-2024-38178
CVE-2024-38213 : https://msrc.microsoft.com/update-guide/en-US/vulnerability/CVE-2024-38213
CVE-2024-38193 : https://msrc.microsoft.com/update-guide/en-US/vulnerability/CVE-2024-38193
CVE-2024-38106 : https://msrc.microsoft.com/update-guide/en-US/vulnerability/CVE-2024-38106
CVE-2024-38107 : https://msrc.microsoft.com/update-guide/en-US/vulnerability/CVE-2024-38107

Remaining 4 Zero-Day Flaws:

CVE-2024-38202 : https://msrc.microsoft.com/update-guide/en-US/advisory/CVE-2024-38202
CVE-2024-38200 : https://msrc.microsoft.com/update-guide/en-US/advisory/CVE-2024-38200
CVE-2024-21302 : https://msrc.microsoft.com/update-guide/en-US/advisory/CVE-2024-21302
CVE-2024-38199 : https://msrc.microsoft.com/update-guide/en-US/advisory/CVE-2024-38199

screaminggoat at 2024-08-13T17:36:35.688Z ##

Happy Patch Tuesday from Microsoft: 87 vulnerabilities, 7 zero-days (6 exploited)

  • CVE-2024-38189 (8.8 high) Microsoft Project Remote Code Execution Vulnerability (exploited)
  • CVE-2024-38107 (7.8 high) Windows Power Dependency Coordinator Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability (exploited)
  • CVE-2024-38106 (7.0 high) Windows Kernel Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability (exploited)
  • CVE-2024-38213 (6.5 medium) Windows Mark of the Web Security Feature Bypass Vulnerability (exploited)
  • CVE-2024-38193 (7.8 high) Windows Ancillary Function Driver for WinSock Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability (exploited)
  • CVE-2024-38178 (7.5 high) Scripting Engine Memory Corruption Vulnerability (exploited)
  • CVE-2024-38199 (9.8 critical) Windows Line Printer Daemon (LPD) Service Remote Code Execution Vulnerability (publicly disclosed)

cisakevtracker@mastodon.social at 2024-08-13T19:02:15.000Z ##

CVE ID: CVE-2024-38189
Vendor: Microsoft
Product: Project
Date Added: 2024-08-13
Vulnerability: Microsoft Project Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
Notes: https://msrc.microsoft.com/update-guide/vulnerability/CVE-2024-38189
CVE URL: https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-38189

##
screaminggoat at 2024-08-13T17:36:35.688Z ##

Happy Patch Tuesday from Microsoft: 87 vulnerabilities, 7 zero-days (6 exploited)

  • CVE-2024-38189 (8.8 high) Microsoft Project Remote Code Execution Vulnerability (exploited)
  • CVE-2024-38107 (7.8 high) Windows Power Dependency Coordinator Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability (exploited)
  • CVE-2024-38106 (7.0 high) Windows Kernel Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability (exploited)
  • CVE-2024-38213 (6.5 medium) Windows Mark of the Web Security Feature Bypass Vulnerability (exploited)
  • CVE-2024-38193 (7.8 high) Windows Ancillary Function Driver for WinSock Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability (exploited)
  • CVE-2024-38178 (7.5 high) Scripting Engine Memory Corruption Vulnerability (exploited)
  • CVE-2024-38199 (9.8 critical) Windows Line Printer Daemon (LPD) Service Remote Code Execution Vulnerability (publicly disclosed)

cc: @campuscodi @briankrebs @mttaggart @deepthoughts10 @cR0w @regnil @bschwifty @arinc629 @Cali @wvu @hrbrmstr @avoidthehack @bieberium @TheDustinChilds @dreadpir8robots (make sure to remove all the mentions to avoid ReplyAll madness)

#Microsoft #zeroday #vulnerability #eitw #proofofconcept #CVE #PatchTuesday

Happy Patch Tuesday from Microsoft: 87 vulnerabilities, 7 zero-days (6 exploited)

  • CVE-2024-38189 (8.8 high) Microsoft Project Remote Code Execution Vulnerability (exploited)
  • CVE-2024-38107 (7.8 high) Windows Power Dependency Coordinator Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability (exploited)
  • CVE-2024-38106 (7.0 high) Windows Kernel Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability (exploited)

  • CVE-2024-38193 (7.8 high) Windows Ancillary Function Driver for WinSock Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability (exploited)
  • CVE-2024-38178 (7.5 high) Scripting Engine Memory Corruption Vulnerability (exploited)
  • CVE-2024-38199 (9.8 critical) Windows Line Printer Daemon (LPD) Service Remote Code Execution Vulnerability (publicly disclosed)

##

CVE-2024-20419
(10.0 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-08-13T18:31:18

4 posts

A vulnerability in the authentication system of Cisco Smart Software Manager On-Prem (SSM On-Prem) could allow an unauthenticated, remote attacker to change the password of any user, including administrative users. This vulnerability is due to improper implementation of the password-change process. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by sending crafted HTTP requests to an affected devic

AAKL at 2024-08-10T16:11:20.402Z ##

From yesterday, if you missed it.

Tenable: CVE-2024-20419: #Cisco Smart Software Manager On-prem Password Change Vulnerability https://www.tenable.com/blog/cve-2024-20419-cisco-smart-software-manager-on-prem-password-change-vulnerability @tenable #cybersecurity #infosec

##
screaminggoat at 2024-08-07T18:48:08.708Z ##

Cisco updated their security advisory Cisco Smart Software Manager On-Prem Password Change Vulnerability today to say that proof-of-concept code for CVE-2024-20419 is available.

cc: @cR0w @mttaggart

##

CVE-2024-38219
(6.5 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.05%

updated 2024-08-13T18:15:31.623000

2 posts

Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) Remote Code Execution Vulnerability

screaminggoat at 2024-08-08T22:14:41.620Z ##

Microsoft Security Response Center (MSRC) has 9 total security advisories, 6 of which are just documenting that Edge is patched against Chromium vulnerabilities disclosed Tuesday by Google (see parent toot above). The new ones are as follows:

  • CVE-2024-38200 (7.5 high) Microsoft Office Spoofing Vulnerability (Note: unpatched)
    • When will an update be available to address this vulnerability?
      Microsoft is fully aware of this issue and is actively working to release an update to address it.
  • CVE-2024-38218 (8.4 high) Microsoft Edge (HTML-based) Memory Corruption Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-38219 (8.4 high) Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) Remote Code Execution Vulnerability

Not exploited, not publicly disclosed, exploitation less likely. Definitely read up on CVE-2024-38200 as no patch is available yet.

#Microsoft #vulnerability #CVE_2024_38200 #CVE_2024_38218 #CVE_2024_38219 #Chromium #Chrome

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-08-08T22:14:41.000Z ##

Microsoft Security Response Center (MSRC) has 9 total security advisories, 6 of which are just documenting that Edge is patched against Chromium vulnerabilities disclosed Tuesday by Google (see parent toot above). The new ones are as follows:

  • CVE-2024-38200 (7.5 high) Microsoft Office Spoofing Vulnerability (Note: unpatched)
    • When will an update be available to address this vulnerability?
      Microsoft is fully aware of this issue and is actively working to release an update to address it.
  • CVE-2024-38218 (8.4 high) Microsoft Edge (HTML-based) Memory Corruption Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-38219 (8.4 high) Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) Remote Code Execution Vulnerability

Not exploited, not publicly disclosed, exploitation less likely. Definitely read up on CVE-2024-38200 as no patch is available yet.

##

CVE-2024-38200
(6.5 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.32%

updated 2024-08-13T18:15:29.720000

17 posts

Microsoft Office Spoofing Vulnerability

screaminggoat at 2024-08-12T14:58:10.597Z ##

Microsoft Security Response Center (MSRC) CVE Update: CVE-2024-38200 (7.5 high) Microsoft Office Spoofing Vulnerability (Note: unpatched)
On 10 August 2024, Microsoft updated the security advisory for CVE-2024-38200, noting that it was publicly disclosed. While they mention that they "identified an alternative fix to this issue that we enabled via Feature Flighting on 7/30/2024. Customers are already protected on all in-support versions of Microsoft Office and Microsoft 365", the security updates section does not include a KB article or Download/build number. The fix is almost certainly coming out tomorrow on #PatchTuesday.

cc: @TheDustinChilds to answer your question from the bad place: https://twitter.com/dustin_childs/status/1821664478435668053

#CVE_2024_38200 #vulnerability #Microsoft #MSRC #CVE

##
screaminggoat at 2024-08-08T22:14:41.620Z ##

Microsoft Security Response Center (MSRC) has 9 total security advisories, 6 of which are just documenting that Edge is patched against Chromium vulnerabilities disclosed Tuesday by Google (see parent toot above). The new ones are as follows:

  • CVE-2024-38200 (7.5 high) Microsoft Office Spoofing Vulnerability (Note: unpatched)
    • When will an update be available to address this vulnerability?
      Microsoft is fully aware of this issue and is actively working to release an update to address it.
  • CVE-2024-38218 (8.4 high) Microsoft Edge (HTML-based) Memory Corruption Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-38219 (8.4 high) Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) Remote Code Execution Vulnerability

Not exploited, not publicly disclosed, exploitation less likely. Definitely read up on CVE-2024-38200 as no patch is available yet.

#Microsoft #vulnerability #CVE_2024_38200 #CVE_2024_38218 #CVE_2024_38219 #Chromium #Chrome

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-08-12T14:58:10.000Z ##

Microsoft Security Response Center (MSRC) CVE Update: CVE-2024-38200 (7.5 high) Microsoft Office Spoofing Vulnerability (Note: unpatched)
On 10 August 2024, Microsoft updated the security advisory for CVE-2024-38200, noting that it was publicly disclosed. While they mention that they "identified an alternative fix to this issue that we enabled via Feature Flighting on 7/30/2024. Customers are already protected on all in-support versions of Microsoft Office and Microsoft 365", the security updates section does not include a KB article or Download/build number. The fix is almost certainly coming out tomorrow on #PatchTuesday.

cc: @TheDustinChilds to answer your question from the bad place: https://twitter.com/dustin_childs/status/1821664478435668053

#CVE_2024_38200 #vulnerability #Microsoft #MSRC #CVE

  • CVE-2024-38200 (7.5 high) Microsoft Office Spoofing Vulnerability (Note: unpatched)
    • When will an update be available to address this vulnerability?

  • CVE-2024-38218 (8.4 high) Microsoft Edge (HTML-based) Memory Corruption Vulnerability

Not exploited, not publicly disclosed, exploitation less likely. Definitely read up on CVE-2024-38200 as no patch is available yet.

Customers are already protected on all in-support versions of Microsoft Office and Microsoft 365", the security updates section does not include a KB article or Download/build number. The fix is almost certainly coming out tomorrow on #PatchTuesday.

patchnow24x7 at 2024-08-14T05:51:58.316Z ##

August 2024 : Microsoft Patch Tuesday Summary

August Patch Tuesday Release Note :
https://msrc.microsoft.com/update-guide/releaseNote/2024-Aug

The following are the 6 zero-day flaws exploited in the wild..

CVE-2024-38189 : https://msrc.microsoft.com/update-guide/en-US/vulnerability/CVE-2024-38189
CVE-2024-38178 : https://msrc.microsoft.com/update-guide/en-US/vulnerability/CVE-2024-38178
CVE-2024-38213 : https://msrc.microsoft.com/update-guide/en-US/vulnerability/CVE-2024-38213
CVE-2024-38193 : https://msrc.microsoft.com/update-guide/en-US/vulnerability/CVE-2024-38193
CVE-2024-38106 : https://msrc.microsoft.com/update-guide/en-US/vulnerability/CVE-2024-38106
CVE-2024-38107 : https://msrc.microsoft.com/update-guide/en-US/vulnerability/CVE-2024-38107

Remaining 4 Zero-Day Flaws:

CVE-2024-38202 : https://msrc.microsoft.com/update-guide/en-US/advisory/CVE-2024-38202
CVE-2024-38200 : https://msrc.microsoft.com/update-guide/en-US/advisory/CVE-2024-38200
CVE-2024-21302 : https://msrc.microsoft.com/update-guide/en-US/advisory/CVE-2024-21302
CVE-2024-38199 : https://msrc.microsoft.com/update-guide/en-US/advisory/CVE-2024-38199

jos1264@social.skynetcloud.site at 2024-08-12T11:00:08.000Z ##

Unpatched MS Office flaw may leak NTLM hashes to attackers (CVE-2024-38200) https://www.helpnetsecurity.com/2024/08/12/cve-2024-38200/ #authentication #Microsoft365 #Don'tmiss #Hotstuff #MSOffice #PrivSec #0-day #News

##
alternativeto@mas.to at 2024-08-12T09:50:34.000Z ##

Microsoft reported a critical Office vulnerability (CVE-2024-38200) that could let attackers access NTLM hashes and login credentials. It affects Office 2016, 2019, LTSC 2021, and Microsoft 365. Users should update immediately and block NTLM traffic.
https://alternativeto.net/news/2024/8/microsoft-urges-updates-for-office-vulnerability-allowing-ntlm-hash-and-login-data-theft/

##

CVE-2024-7589
(8.1 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.06%

updated 2024-08-13T16:58:08.793000

8 posts

A signal handler in sshd(8) may call a logging function that is not async-signal-safe. The signal handler is invoked when a client does not authenticate within the LoginGraceTime seconds (120 by default). This signal handler executes in the context of the sshd(8)'s privileged code, which is not sandboxed and runs with full root privileges. This issue is another instance of the problem in CVE-20

jos1264@social.skynetcloud.site at 2024-08-12T12:05:02.000Z ##

Critical OpenSSH Vulnerability in FreeBSD Allows Remote Root Access https://thecyberexpress.com/openssh-vulnerability-in-freebsd/ #vulnerabilityinFreeBSD #OpenSSHVulnerability #TheCyberExpressNews #CybersecurityNews #Vulnerabilities #TheCyberExpress #FirewallDaily #CVE20247589 #blacklistd #SSHdaemon

jos1264@social.skynetcloud.site at 2024-08-12T12:05:02.000Z ##

##
alternativeto@mas.to at 2024-08-14T15:53:03.000Z ##

FreeBSD released a security update for a high-severity OpenSSH flaw (CVE-2024-7589) that allows remote code execution. Users should update and restart sshd or set LoginGraceTime to 0 to mitigate risks.
https://alternativeto.net/news/2024/8/freebsd-issues-critical-update-to-patch-openssh-vulnerability/

##
patchnow24x7 at 2024-08-13T06:04:54.696Z ##

CVE-2024-7589 :: regreSSHion type vulnerability in FreeBSD.

Advisory:
https://www.freebsd.org/security/advisories/FreeBSD-SA-24:08.openssh.asc

##

CVE-2024-6768
(0 None)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-08-13T12:58:25.437000

4 posts

A Denial of Service in CLFS.sys in Microsoft Windows 10, Windows 11, Windows Server 2016, Windows Server 2019, and Windows Server 2022 allows a malicious authenticated low-privilege user to cause a Blue Screen of Death via a forced call to the KeBugCheckEx function.

1 repos

https://github.com/fortra/CVE-2024-6768

mttaggart@infosec.town at 2024-08-12T18:29:16.791Z ##

Hmmm. Fortra is claiming this CVE, but Microsoft refuses to acknowledge it.

A Denial of Service in CLFS.sys in Microsoft Windows 10, Windows 11, Windows Server 2016, Windows Server 2019, and Windows Server 2022 allows a malicious authenticated low-privilege user to cause a Blue Screen of Death via a forced call to the KeBugCheckEx function.
www.fortra.com/security/advisories/research/fr-2024-001

#CVE_2024_6768

RE: infosec.exchange/users/happygeek/statuses/112950422855411685

##

CVE-2024-37287
(9.1 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-08-13T12:30:53

3 posts

A flaw allowing arbitrary code execution was discovered in Kibana. An attacker with access to ML and Alerting connector features, as well as write access to internal ML indices can trigger a prototype pollution vulnerability, ultimately leading to arbitrary code execution.

patchnow24x7 at 2024-08-07T11:48:13.168Z ##

VALIDATE YOUR ORGANISATION'S IT ENVIRONMENT FOR KIBANA INSTALLATIONS

Critical : CVE-2024-37287 :: CVSS Score : 9.9

Prototype Pollution vulnerability in Kibana.

Advisory:

https://discuss.elastic.co/t/kibana-8-14-2-7-17-23-security-update-esa-2024-22/364424


#PatchNOW

https://discuss.elastic.co/t/kibana-8-14-2-7-17-23-security-update-esa-2024-22/364424

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-08-05T22:54:45.000Z ##

Elastic: Kibana 8.14.2 / 7.17.23 Security Update (ESA-2024-22)
CVE-2024-37287 (9.9 critical) Kibana arbitrary code execution via prototype pollution (ESA-2024-22) An attacker with access to ML and Alerting connector features, as well as write access to internal ML indices can trigger a prototype pollution vulnerability, ultimately leading to arbitrary code execution.
No mention of exploitation.

#CVE_2024_37287 #Elastic #vulnerability #Kibana #CVE

##

CVE-2024-41730
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-08-13T06:31:44

3 posts

In SAP BusinessObjects Business Intelligence Platform, if Single Signed On is enabled on Enterprise authentication, an unauthorized user can get a logon token using a REST endpoint. The attacker can fully compromise the system resulting in High impact on confidentiality, integrity and availability.

jbhall56 at 2024-08-14T11:42:10.084Z ##

The flaw, tracked as CVE-2024-41730 and rated 9.8 as per the CVSS v3.1 system, is a "missing authentication check" bug impacting SAP BusinessObjects Business Intelligence Platform versions 430 and 440 and is exploitable under certain conditions. https://www.bleepingcomputer.com/news/security/critical-sap-flaw-allows-remote-attackers-to-bypass-authentication/

##
patchnow24x7 at 2024-08-14T04:21:34.227Z ##

CVE-2024-41730 :: Missing Authentication in SAP BusinessObejects Business Intelligence could lead to ENTIRE SYSTEM COMPROMISE

Advisory:

https://support.sap.com/en/my-support/knowledge-base/security-notes-news/august-2024.html

https://me.sap.com/notes/3479478 (Needs Log-in)

#PatchNOW
#SAP

##
jbhall56@infosec.exchange at 2024-08-14T11:42:10.000Z ##

The flaw, tracked as CVE-2024-41730 and rated 9.8 as per the CVSS v3.1 system, is a "missing authentication check" bug impacting SAP BusinessObjects Business Intelligence Platform versions 430 and 440 and is exploitable under certain conditions. https://www.bleepingcomputer.com/news/security/critical-sap-flaw-allows-remote-attackers-to-bypass-authentication/

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-08-13T03:31:27

2 posts

The JS Help Desk â The Ultimate Help Desk & Support Plugin plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to PHP Code Injection leading to Remote Code Execution in all versions up to, and including, 2.8.6 via the 'storeTheme' function. This is due to a lack of sanitization on user-supplied values, which replace values in the style.php file, along with missing capability checks. This makes it possible for unau

- WP Bannerize Pro Stored Cross-Site Scripting via banner alt data vulnerability - CVE-2024-7388 https://www.wordfence.com/threat-intel/vulnerabilities/wordpress-plugins/wp-bannerize-pro/wp-bannerize-pro-190-authenticated-editor-stored-cross-site-scripting #cybersecurity #infosec

CVE-2024-7388
(4.0 None)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-08-13T03:31:22

2 posts

The WP Bannerize Pro plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to Stored Cross-Site Scripting via banner alt data in all versions up to, and including, 1.9.0 due to insufficient input sanitization and output escaping. This makes it possible for authenticated attackers, with editor-level permissions and above, to inject arbitrary web scripts in pages that will execute whenever a user accesses an injected

##

CVE-2024-7534
(8.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.06%

updated 2024-08-12T21:31:33

2 posts

Heap buffer overflow in Layout in Google Chrome prior to 127.0.6533.99 allowed a remote attacker to potentially exploit heap corruption via a crafted HTML page. (Chromium security severity: High)

screaminggoat at 2024-08-06T20:15:19.493Z ##

Google Chrome security advisory: Stable Channel Update for Desktop
Google does not know how to count past five as they state 5 security fixes but list 6 externally reported vulnerabilities:

  1. CVE-2024-7532 (critical) Out of bounds memory access in ANGLE
  2. CVE-2024-7533 (high) Use after free in Sharing.
  3. CVE-2024-7550 (high) Type Confusion in V8.
  4. CVE-2024-7534 (high) Heap buffer overflow in Layout
  5. CVE-2024-7535 (high): Inappropriate implementation in V8
  6. CVE-2024-7536 (high) Use after free in WebAudio.

No mention of exploitation.

#CVE_2024_7532 #Google #Chrome #PatchTuesday #vulnerability #CVE

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-08-06T20:15:19.000Z ##

  1. CVE-2024-7532 (critical) Out of bounds memory access in ANGLE
  2. CVE-2024-7533 (high) Use after free in Sharing.

  6. CVE-2024-7536 (high) Use after free in WebAudio.

CVE-2024-42393
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.09%

updated 2024-08-12T18:30:48

1 posts

There are vulnerabilities in the Soft AP Daemon Service which could allow a threat actor to execute an unauthenticated RCE attack. Successful exploitation could allow an attacker to execute arbitrary commands on the underlying operating system leading to complete system compromise.

patchnow24x7 at 2024-08-16T07:36:36.430Z ##

CRITICAL : CVE-2024-42393, CVE-2024-42394 and CVE-2024-42395 : Unauthenticated Stack-Based Buffer Overflow vulnerability in HPE Aruba Access Points leading to Remote Code Execution.

Advisory:
https://support.hpe.com/hpesc/public/docDisplay?docId=hpesbnw04678en_us&docLocale=en_US

CVE-2024-5527
(8.3 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-08-12T15:31:01

2 posts

Zohocorp ManageEngine ADAudit Plus versions belowÂ 8110 are vulnerable to authenticated SQL Injection in file auditing configuration.

screaminggoat at 2024-08-13T11:26:57.331Z ##

Zoho ManageEngine security advisories:

  • Authenticated SQL Injection Vulnerability (CVE-2024-5527) fixed in ADAudit Plus build 8110 CVE-2024-5527 (vendor 8.3 high) authenticated SQL Injection in file auditing configuration
  • Authenticated SQL Injection Vulnerability (CVE-2024-5487) fixed in ADAudit Plus build 8110 CVE-2024-5487 (vendor 8.3 high) authenticated SQL Injection in attack surface analyzer's export option
  • Authenticated SQL Injection Vulnerability (CVE-2024-36518) fixed in ADAudit Plus build 8110 CVE-2024-36518 (vendor 8.3 high) authenticated SQL Injection in attack surface analyzer's dashboard

No mention of exploitation. Mitre and NVD only have publish dates from yesterday 12 August 2024, even though the Zoho advisories marked them fixed 14 June 2024. Zoho also doesn't indicate when the advisories were published. Happy #PatchTuesday

#Zoho #vulnerability #cve

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-08-13T11:26:57.000Z ##

Zoho ManageEngine security advisories:

  • Authenticated SQL Injection Vulnerability (CVE-2024-5527) fixed in ADAudit Plus build 8110 CVE-2024-5527 (vendor 8.3 high) authenticated SQL Injection in file auditing configuration
  • Authenticated SQL Injection Vulnerability (CVE-2024-5487) fixed in ADAudit Plus build 8110 CVE-2024-5487 (vendor 8.3 high) authenticated SQL Injection in attack surface analyzer's export option
  • Authenticated SQL Injection Vulnerability (CVE-2024-36518) fixed in ADAudit Plus build 8110 CVE-2024-36518 (vendor 8.3 high) authenticated SQL Injection in attack surface analyzer's dashboard

No mention of exploitation. Mitre and NVD only have publish dates from yesterday 12 August 2024, even though the Zoho advisories marked them fixed 14 June 2024. Zoho also doesn't indicate when the advisories were published. Happy #PatchTuesday

  • Authenticated SQL Injection Vulnerability (CVE-2024-5527) fixed in ADAudit Plus build 8110 CVE-2024-5527 (vendor 8.3 high) authenticated SQL Injection in file auditing configuration

  • Authenticated SQL Injection Vulnerability (CVE-2024-5487) fixed in ADAudit Plus build 8110 CVE-2024-5487 (vendor 8.3 high) authenticated SQL Injection in attack surface analyzer's export option
  • Authenticated SQL Injection Vulnerability (CVE-2024-36518) fixed in ADAudit Plus build 8110 CVE-2024-36518 (vendor 8.3 high) authenticated SQL Injection in attack surface analyzer's dashboard

No mention of exploitation. Mitre and NVD only have publish dates from yesterday 12 August 2024, even though the Zoho advisories marked them fixed 14 June 2024. Zoho also doesn't indicate when the advisories were published. Happy #PatchTuesday

#Zoho #vulnerability #cve

CVE-2024-37283 (CVSSv4: 6.5 medium) Elastic Agent Insertion of Sensitive Information into Log File (ESA-2024-23)
No mention of exploitation. No Elastic Cloud customers are affected. The issue is resolved in version 8.15.0.

NVIDIA GPU Display Driver for Windows contains a vulnerability in the user mode layer, where an unprivileged regular user can cause an out-of-bounds read. A successful exploit of this vulnerability might lead to code execution, denial of service, escalation of privileges, information disclosure, and data tampering.

CVE-2024-7348
(8.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.05%

updated 2024-08-08T15:31:31

1 posts

Time-of-check Time-of-use (TOCTOU) race condition in pg_dump in PostgreSQL allows an object creator to execute arbitrary SQL functions as the user running pg_dump, which is often a superuser. The attack involves replacing another relation type with a view or foreign table. The attack requires waiting for pg_dump to start, but winning the race condition is trivial if the attacker retains an open tr

##
avoidthehack at 2024-08-08T14:44:02.327Z ##

#Windows Update downgrade attack "unpatches" fully-updated systems

Downgrade attacks could rollback Windows updates, while Windows Update indicates the system is fully updated. Rollbacks could then expose the system to many past vulnerabilities.

(CVE-2024-38202 and CVE-2024-21302)

No apparent evidence of exploitation in the wild. #Microsoft is working/testing patches for this currently.

#cve #security #cybersecurity

https://www.bleepingcomputer.com/news/microsoft/windows-update-downgrade-attack-unpatches-fully-updated-systems/

##
patchnow24x7 at 2024-08-08T09:48:49.254Z ##

BEWARE WINDOWS ADMINISTRATORS !!

Zero-Day flaw that downgrades your Windows Systems -- CVE-2024-38202 , CVE-2024-21302

Advisory:

CVE-2024-38202 : https://msrc.microsoft.com/update-guide/vulnerability/CVE-2024-38202

CVE-2024-21302 : https://msrc.microsoft.com/update-guide/vulnerability/CVE-2024-21302

Explaination by SafeBreach(who discovered this flaw):

https://www.safebreach.com/blog/downgrade-attacks-using-windows-updates/

#PatchNOW
#Microsoft
#Windows

##
screaminggoat at 2024-08-07T18:58:27.645Z ##

MICROSOFT ZERO-DAYS (both CVE IDs are UNPATCHED)
As promised, Microsoft Security Response Center (MSRC) published not one but TWO security advisories in regards to a Windows Update issue allowing for software-downgrade attacks (see parent toot above):

  • CVE-2024-21302 (6.7 medium) Windows Secure Kernel Mode Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability (PUBLICLY DISCLOSED)
  • CVE-2024-38202 (7.3 high) Windows Update Stack Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability (PUBLICLY DISCLOSED)

Microsoft was notified that an elevation of privilege vulnerability exists in Windows based systems supporting Virtualization Based Security (VBS) including a subset of Azure Virtual Machine SKUS; enabling an attacker with administrator privileges to replace current versions of Windows system files with outdated versions. By exploiting this vulnerability, an attacker could reintroduce previously mitigated vulnerabilities, circumvent some features of VBS, and exfiltrate data protected by VBS.
A security researcher informed Microsoft of an elevation of privilege vulnerability in Windows Backup potentially enabling an attacker with basic user privileges to reintroduce previously mitigated vulnerabilities or circumvent some features of VBS. For exploitation to succeed, an attacker must trick or convince an Administrator or a user with delegated permissions into performing a system restore which inadvertently triggers the vulnerability.
Microsoft is developing a security update to mitigate this threat, but it is not yet available.

cc: @campuscodi @briankrebs @wdormann @ntkramer

#CVE_2024_21302 #CVE_2024_38202 #Microsoft #vulnerability #CVE

##
screaminggoat at 2024-08-07T15:33:50.763Z ##

Security Week: Windows Update Flaws Allow Undetectable Downgrade Attacks
SafeBreach Labs is presenting at Black Hat 2024, warning that malicious hackers can launch software downgrade attacks (against Windows Update for example) that cause the operating system revert an immune, fully up-to-date software back to an older version with known, exploitable vulnerabilities, and to falsely report that it is fully updated.

Another key point from this article is that "Microsoft plans to publish a CVE on Wednesday alongside Leviev's Black Hat presentation and will provide customers with mitigations or relevant risk reduction guidance as they become available." EDIT: CVE-2024-21302 and CVE-2024-38202 were published. Unpatched and publicly disclosed!

EDIT2: See related SafeBreach article: Windows Downdate: Downgrade Attacks Using Windows Updates h/t @wdormann for finding it:

#downgradeattack #windowsupdate #CVE_2024_21302 #CVE_2024_38202

(CVE-2024-38202 and CVE-2024-21302)

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-08-07T18:58:27.000Z ##

MICROSOFT ZERO-DAYS (both CVE IDs are UNPATCHED)
As promised, Microsoft Security Response Center (MSRC) published not one but TWO security advisories in regards to a Windows Update issue allowing for software-downgrade attacks (see parent toot above):

  • CVE-2024-21302 (6.7 medium) Windows Secure Kernel Mode Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability (PUBLICLY DISCLOSED)
  • CVE-2024-38202 (7.3 high) Windows Update Stack Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability (PUBLICLY DISCLOSED)

Microsoft was notified that an elevation of privilege vulnerability exists in Windows based systems supporting Virtualization Based Security (VBS) including a subset of Azure Virtual Machine SKUS; enabling an attacker with administrator privileges to replace current versions of Windows system files with outdated versions. By exploiting this vulnerability, an attacker could reintroduce previously mitigated vulnerabilities, circumvent some features of VBS, and exfiltrate data protected by VBS.
A security researcher informed Microsoft of an elevation of privilege vulnerability in Windows Backup potentially enabling an attacker with basic user privileges to reintroduce previously mitigated vulnerabilities or circumvent some features of VBS. For exploitation to succeed, an attacker must trick or convince an Administrator or a user with delegated permissions into performing a system restore which inadvertently triggers the vulnerability.
Microsoft is developing a security update to mitigate this threat, but it is not yet available.

cc: @campuscodi @briankrebs @wdormann @ntkramer

Security Week: Windows Update Flaws Allow Undetectable Downgrade Attacks
SafeBreach Labs is presenting at Black Hat 2024, warning that malicious hackers can launch software downgrade attacks (against Windows Update for example) that cause the operating system revert an immune, fully up-to-date software back to an older version with known, exploitable vulnerabilities, and to falsely report that it is fully updated.

Another key point from this article is that "Microsoft plans to publish a CVE on Wednesday alongside Leviev's Black Hat presentation and will provide customers with mitigations or relevant risk reduction guidance as they become available." EDIT: CVE-2024-21302 and CVE-2024-38202 were published. Unpatched and publicly disclosed!

EDIT2: See related SafeBreach article: Windows Downdate: Downgrade Attacks Using Windows Updates h/t @wdormann for finding it:

#downgradeattack #windowsupdate #CVE_2024_21302 #CVE_2024_38202

##
avolha@infosec.exchange at 2024-08-10T07:56:59.000Z ##

A we wtorek czekam na Åatki, ktÃ³re naprawiÄ dziury pozwalajÄce na atak Windows Downdate, czyli "odÅatanie" w peÅni zaktualizowanych systemÃ³w, co otwiera drogÄ do ich przejÄcia

:finger_point: https://www.safebreach.com/blog/downgrade-attacks-using-windows-updates/
TL;DR https://www.bleepingcomputer.com/news/microsoft/windows-update-downgrade-attack-unpatches-fully-updated-systems/

Wspomniane, jeszcze niezaÅatane, luki:
:finger_point: https://msrc.microsoft.com/update-guide/vulnerability/CVE-2024-21302
:finger_point: https://msrc.microsoft.com/update-guide/vulnerability/CVE-2024-38202

#infosec #cyberbezpieczenstwo #windows

##
avoidthehack@infosec.exchange at 2024-08-08T14:44:02.000Z ##

#Windows Update downgrade attack "unpatches" fully-updated systems

Downgrade attacks could rollback Windows updates, while Windows Update indicates the system is fully updated. Rollbacks could then expose the system to many past vulnerabilities.

(CVE-2024-38202 and CVE-2024-21302)

No apparent evidence of exploitation in the wild. #Microsoft is working/testing patches for this currently.

#cve #security #cybersecurity

https://www.bleepingcomputer.com/news/microsoft/windows-update-downgrade-attack-unpatches-fully-updated-systems/

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-08-07T18:58:27.000Z ##

MICROSOFT ZERO-DAYS (both CVE IDs are UNPATCHED)
As promised, Microsoft Security Response Center (MSRC) published not one but TWO security advisories in regards to a Windows Update issue allowing for software-downgrade attacks (see parent toot above):

  • CVE-2024-21302 (6.7 medium) Windows Secure Kernel Mode Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability (PUBLICLY DISCLOSED)
  • CVE-2024-38202 (7.3 high) Windows Update Stack Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability (PUBLICLY DISCLOSED)

Microsoft was notified that an elevation of privilege vulnerability exists in Windows based systems supporting Virtualization Based Security (VBS) including a subset of Azure Virtual Machine SKUS; enabling an attacker with administrator privileges to replace current versions of Windows system files with outdated versions. By exploiting this vulnerability, an attacker could reintroduce previously mitigated vulnerabilities, circumvent some features of VBS, and exfiltrate data protected by VBS.
A security researcher informed Microsoft of an elevation of privilege vulnerability in Windows Backup potentially enabling an attacker with basic user privileges to reintroduce previously mitigated vulnerabilities or circumvent some features of VBS. For exploitation to succeed, an attacker must trick or convince an Administrator or a user with delegated permissions into performing a system restore which inadvertently triggers the vulnerability.
Microsoft is developing a security update to mitigate this threat, but it is not yet available.

cc: @campuscodi @briankrebs @wdormann @ntkramer

#CVE_2024_21302 #CVE_2024_38202 #Microsoft #vulnerability #CVE

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-08-07T15:33:50.000Z ##

Security Week: Windows Update Flaws Allow Undetectable Downgrade Attacks
SafeBreach Labs is presenting at Black Hat 2024, warning that malicious hackers can launch software downgrade attacks (against Windows Update for example) that cause the operating system revert an immune, fully up-to-date software back to an older version with known, exploitable vulnerabilities, and to falsely report that it is fully updated.

Another key point from this article is that "Microsoft plans to publish a CVE on Wednesday alongside Leviev's Black Hat presentation and will provide customers with mitigations or relevant risk reduction guidance as they become available." EDIT: CVE-2024-21302 and CVE-2024-38202 were published. Unpatched and publicly disclosed!

EDIT2: See related SafeBreach article: Windows Downdate: Downgrade Attacks Using Windows Updates h/t @wdormann for finding it:

#downgradeattack #windowsupdate #CVE_2024_21302 #CVE_2024_38202

##

CVE-2024-42219
(7.0 None)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-08-07T21:32:50

8 posts

1Password 8 before 8.10.36 for macOS allows local attackers to exfiltrate vault items because XPC inter-process communication validation is insufficient.

jos1264@social.skynetcloud.site at 2024-08-09T12:35:04.000Z ##

Critical 1Password flaws may allow hackers to snatch your passwords (CVE-2024-42219, CVE-2024-42218) https://www.helpnetsecurity.com/2024/08/09/cve-2024-42219-cve-2024-42218/ #securityassessment #passwordmanager #vulnerability #Don'tmiss #1Password #passwords #Hotstuff #macOS #News #CVE

##
avoidthehack at 2024-08-08T19:43:03.970Z ##

CVE-2024-42219 for #1Password 8 for Mac

"To exploit the issue, an attacker must run malicious software on a computer specifically targeting 1Password for Mac. An attacker is able to misuse missing macOS specific inter-process validations to hijack or impersonate a trusted 1Password integration such as the 1Password browser extension or CLI."

No evidence of exploitation in the wild.

Naturally, you'd also have other issues alongside this (such as potentially dealing with other malware being dropped on the device, like RATs or infostealers).

I usually stick to and prefer Bitwarden... but for anyone using 1Password out there (once upon a time, I did) on macOS, make sure to update to 1Password for macOS version 8.10.36

#apple #security #macos #cybersecurity

https://support.1password.com/kb/202408a/

##
kurtseifried at 2024-08-08T17:12:22.021Z ##

You know what's missing from #1Password https://releases.1password.com/mac/8.10/ ? CVE-2024-42219 and the app/UI didn't prompt me significantly to update or mention a security issue. sad panda face. Do better 1Password.

##
screaminggoat at 2024-08-08T01:48:18.579Z ##

1Password security advisory: CVE-2024-42219 for 1Password 8 for Mac
CVE-2024-42219 (CISA-ADP CVSSv3: 7.0 high) 1Password 8 before 8.10.36 for macOS allows local attackers to exfiltrate vault items because XPC inter-process communication validation is insufficient.

To exploit the issue, an attacker must run malicious software on a computer specifically targeting 1Password for Mac. An attacker is able to misuse missing macOS specific inter-process validations to hijack or impersonate a trusted 1Password integration such as the 1Password browser extension or CLI.
This would permit the malicious software to exfiltrate vault items, as well as obtain derived values used to sign in to 1Password, specifically the account unlock key and âSRP-ð¥â

1Password has received no reports that this issue was discovered or exploited by anyone else.

#CVE_2024_42219 #1password #vulnerability #CVE

##
jos1264@social.skynetcloud.site at 2024-08-09T12:35:04.000Z ##

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-08-08T01:48:18.000Z ##

1Password security advisory: CVE-2024-42219 for 1Password 8 for Mac
CVE-2024-42219 (CISA-ADP CVSSv3: 7.0 high) 1Password 8 before 8.10.36 for macOS allows local attackers to exfiltrate vault items because XPC inter-process communication validation is insufficient.

To exploit the issue, an attacker must run malicious software on a computer specifically targeting 1Password for Mac. An attacker is able to misuse missing macOS specific inter-process validations to hijack or impersonate a trusted 1Password integration such as the 1Password browser extension or CLI.
This would permit the malicious software to exfiltrate vault items, as well as obtain derived values used to sign in to 1Password, specifically the account unlock key and âSRP-ð¥â

1Password has received no reports that this issue was discovered or exploited by anyone else.

#CVE_2024_42219 #1password #vulnerability #CVE

CVE-2024-6886
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-08-07T19:41:40

4 posts

Improper Neutralization of Input During Web Page Generation (XSS or 'Cross-site Scripting') vulnerability in Gitea Gitea Open Source Git Server allows Stored XSS.This issue affects Gitea Open Source Git Server: 1.22.0.

screaminggoat at 2024-08-07T22:22:21.849Z ##

Gitea security advisory: Gitea Cross-site Scripting Vulnerability
Never heard of Gitea until today but it's apparently an "open source Git repository management system" and someone on Reddit said "Gitea is effectively a github clone that runs on-premises. It's a single binary, written in Go"; Shodan search for the word shows in the ballpark of 890 results.

CVE-2024-6886 (CVSSv4: perfect 10.0 maximum severity ð¥³ cc: @cR0w) Improper Neutralization of Input During Web Page Generation (XSS or 'Cross-site Scripting') vulnerability in Gitea Gitea Open Source Git Server allows Stored XSS.This issue affects Gitea Open Source Git Server: 1.22.0.

Interestingly, their security advisory uses CVSSv3.1 (9.8 critical) while the score provided to MITRE/NVD is 4.0 ð¤No mention of exploitation, but it looks like a trivial bug. h/t: @patchnow24x7

#CVE_2024_6886 #Gitea #vulnerability #CVE

##
patchnow24x7 at 2024-08-07T05:20:16.167Z ##

https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-4h4p-553m-46qh
https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-6886 (Showing CVSS Score 10)

CVE-2024-37286
(5.7 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-08-07T19:40:45

1 posts

APM server logs contain document body from a partially failed bulk index request. For example, in case of unavailable_shards_exception for a specific document, since the ES response line contains the document body, and that APM server logs the ES response line on error, the document is effectively logged.

1 repos

#search_error

screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-08-02T21:26:15.000Z ##

Elastic security advisory: APM Server 8.14.0 Security Update (ESA-2024-19)
CVE-2024-37286 (5.7 medium) APM Server Insertion of Sensitive Information into Log File. No mention of exploitation.

#CVE_2024_37286 #Elastic #APM #vulnerability #CVE

CVE-2024-20479
(4.8 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-08-07T18:30:44

2 posts

A vulnerability in the web-based management interface of Cisco ISE could allow an authenticated, remote attacker to conduct an XSS attack against a user of the interface. This vulnerability is due to insufficient validation of user-supplied input by the web-based management interface of an affected system. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by injecting malicious code into specific page

screaminggoat at 2024-08-07T16:11:07.821Z ##

Cisco security advisories:

  • Cisco Identity Services Engine Stored Cross-Site Scripting Vulnerabilities
    • CVE-2024-20443 (5.4 medium) A vulnerability in the web-based management interface of Cisco ISE could allow an authenticated, remote attacker to conduct an XSS attack against a user of the interface.
    • CVE-2024-20479 (4.8 medium) A vulnerability in the web-based management interface of Cisco ISE could allow an authenticated, remote attacker to conduct an XSS attack against a user of the interface.
  • Cisco Small Business SPA300 Series and SPA500 Series IP Phones Web UI Vulnerabilities
    • CVE-2024-20450 (9.8 critical) unauth RCE
    • CVE-2024-20452 (9.8 critical) unauth RCE
    • CVE-2024-20454 (9.8 critical) unauth RCE
    • CVE-2024-20451 (7.5 high) unauth DoS
    • CVE-2024-20453 (7.5 high) unauth DoS

The Cisco Product Security Incident Response Team (PSIRT) is not aware of any public announcements or malicious use of the vulnerabilities that are described in this advisory.

    • CVE-2024-20479 (4.8 medium) A vulnerability in the web-based management interface of Cisco ISE could allow an authenticated, remote attacker to conduct an XSS attack against a user of the interface.
  • Cisco Small Business SPA300 Series and SPA500 Series IP Phones Web UI Vulnerabilities
    • CVE-2024-20450 (9.8 critical) unauth RCE
    • CVE-2024-20452 (9.8 critical) unauth RCE
    • CVE-2024-20454 (9.8 critical) unauth RCE
    • CVE-2024-20451 (7.5 high) unauth DoS
    • CVE-2024-20453 (7.5 high) unauth DoS

The Cisco Product Security Incident Response Team (PSIRT) is not aware of any public announcements or malicious use of the vulnerabilities that are described in this advisory.

#Cisco #PatchTuesday #vulnerability #cve

##

CVE-2024-43045
(5.4 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-08-07T18:26:59

2 posts

Jenkins 2.470 and earlier, LTS 2.452.3 and earlier does not perform a permission check in an HTTP endpoint. This allows attackers with Overall/Read permission to access other users' "My Views". Attackers with global View/Configure and View/Delete permissions are also able to change other users' "My Views". Jenkins 2.471, LTS 2.452.4, LTS 2.462.1 restricts access to a userâs "My Views" to the own

screaminggoat at 2024-08-07T15:20:11.230Z ##

Jenkins: Jenkins Security Advisory 2024-08-07

  • CVE-2024-43044 (vendor 9.0 critical) Arbitrary file read vulnerability through agent connections can lead to RCE
  • CVE-2024-43045 (vendor 5.4 medium) Missing permission check allows accessing other users' "My Views"

No mention of exploitation. Here's why you should care about CVE-2024-43044 and CVE-2024-4345: Jenkins, an open source automation server, has four vulnerabilities in CISA's Known Exploited Vulnerabilities (KEV) Catalog since 2022.

#CVE_2024_43044 #CVE_2024_43045 #Jenkins #vulnerability #CVE
